samples.question: So what makes meeting this advertisement so useful?
samples.transcript: First of all, it highlights the benefits of nutrition consumption at a time when the children especially Vietnamese children is relying so heavily on the story of processed food. It remind me of how effective such small activities in our daily life. >> Okay.

samples.question: What do you think of online advertising?
samples.transcript: >> I think online advertising is incredibly powerful but it is also becoming increasingly sophisticated and intrusive.

samples.question: This is due to what can I say about this?

samples.question: Do you think there is too much advertising nowadays?
samples.transcript: >> Well, I believe just well it does pop up everywhere in our life like inside the elevator or along the street or on our phones. So I think the consumption of advertisement nowadays is a little bit excessive. I think we do not need fewer advertisement. We just need smarter and more responsible kinds of advertisement that respect our intention decision. Not trying to gaslight us of the consumer reason. >> Great.

samples.question: And why do you think buying new things makes people happy?
samples.transcript: I think this is the combination of psychology and culture. Psychologically I can say that this is have already proven by science that purchasing new items can give us a small a temporary domain boost that makes us feel excited and happy. And on a cultural level, I think that it is because owning a new items associated to being a self-care or success. So that is why people want to try to prove their self identity through buying things. But I think such emotion, such feelings is kind of shortlived. So it would be lead it will lead to some kind of unnecessary betas. >> Very good. you have done great. Your test is over for now. Have a good day. >> Thank you. >> Okay.

samples.question: Where do you come from?
samples.transcript: From Hyderabad in India is the largest city in South Indian state of Talangana. I live in suburbs. it is a large densely populated city where there is a lots going on. There are a lot of different things and people to see.

samples.question: And how long have you lived in your home?
samples.transcript: I have lived there for 10 years with my family. That is my mom, my dad, my and my sister. we have large house. We have two floors, a garage, and a reasonably sized garden. Since my sister and I have our own bedrooms, we have no plans to move out in the near future.

samples.question: How did you travel to school when you were younger?
samples.transcript: I used to get a bus to school early in the morning. It was a bus run by school and it was an hour to get to school, but it would pick me up from just outside my apartment block. Then it would also return me late afternoon to where I left at about 4:30 5:00.
